hint.text:
Irreducible factors cannot be broken down further.
Eg: \(x(2x+4y)\) can still be further reduced to \(2x(x+2y).\)

solution.text:
\(_{{4*l}}_x = _{{4*l}}_ \times x, _{{8*l}}_ = 2 \times _{{4*l}}_ \), hence, _{{4*l}}_ is a common factor for both terms
Using distributive law,
\(_{{4*l}}_x + _{{8*l}}_ = _{{4*l}}_(x+2)\)
